components.description: A flag with black and white squares shown in a checkerboard pattern. Used to signal the start or end of a motor car race, though most often used to indicate that the first vehicle within a race has crossed the finish line.
components.title: Chequered Flag

description: A flag with black and white squares shown in a checkerboard pattern. Used to signal the start or end of a motor car race, though most often used to indicate that the first vehicle within a race has crossed the finish line.
title: Chequered Flag

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Sport symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A flag with black and white squares shown in a checkerboard pattern, used to signal the start or end of a motor car race. Chequered Flag was http://emojipedia.org/chequered-flag/
emoji_net_data.name: chequered flag

bn:00099562a: Patterned with alternating squares of color

bn:00092280v: To compete against in such a race.

bn:00088256v: Communicate or signal with a flag

bn:00083395v: To drive fast; to step on the accelerator.

bn:00083885v: To cause to move back and forth repeatedly.
To move or swing back and forth.
Move or swing back and forth
To move or swing a weapon back and forth, particularly if demonstrating skill.

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:00065828n: Competition where the goal is to complete the course as fast as possible
The sport of competing in races.
The sport of engaging in contests of speed
In sport, racing is a competition of speed, against an objective criterion, usually a clock or to a specific point.

bn:00017988n: A pattern made up of a grid of squares of alternating colors; a checkered pattern.
A textile pattern of squares or crossed lines (resembling a checkerboard)
A check is a pattern of modified stripes consisting of crossed horizontal and vertical lines forming squares.
A pattern of squares used on chess-boards, fabrics, etc..

bn:00021338n: Competition is the rivalry of two or more parties over something.
An occasion on which a winner is selected from among two or more contestants
The competitors in such a contest.
A person who takes part in a contest or competition.
Contest between organisms, animals, individuals, groups, etc.

Competition in biology, ecology, and sociology, is a contest between organisms, animals, individuals, groups, etc., for territory, a niche, or a location of resources, for resources and goods, mates, for prestige, recognition, awards, or group or social status, for leadership.
The simultaneous demand by two or more organisms or species for an essential common resource that is actually or potentially in limited supply.
An occasion on which a winner is selected from among two or more contestants.
